solution_line_template: Ken paid ${sailboat_hourly_rate} x {hours_rented_per_day} = $<<{sailboat_hourly_rate}*{hours_rented_per_day}={ken_cost_per_day}>>{ken_cost_per_day} to rent a sailboat for {hours_rented_per_day} hours in a day

Aldrich paid ${ski_boat_hourly_rate} x {hours_rented_per_day} = $<<{ski_boat_hourly_rate}*{hours_rented_per_day}={aldrich_cost_per_day}>>{aldrich_cost_per_day} to rent a ski boat in {hours_rented_per_day} hours in a day.

So Aldrich paid ${aldrich_cost_per_day} - ${ken_cost_per_day} = $<<{aldrich_cost_per_day}-{ken_cost_per_day}={daily_cost_difference}>>{daily_cost_difference} more to rent a ski boat than Ken to rent the sailboat each day.

Therefore, it cost Aldrich ${daily_cost_difference} x {num_days} = $<<{daily_cost_difference}*{num_days}={total_cost_difference}>>{total_cost_difference} more to rent a ski boat than Ken to rent the sailboat in two days.
